original: Johnsson, Frida, läroverksadjunkt, Halmstad, f. 31/12/91 i Hästveda, Krist. 1., av Sven J. o. h. h. — Stud:-ex. i Lund 14, fil. mag. där 18. E. o. där. v. Kopparbergs priv. samsk. 18-19, i Åstorp 19-22, i Sandviken 22-23, åter i Åstorp 23-25, i Säter 25, i Klippan 26-27, i Södertälje 27, adj. i hist. m. samh ilära o. geogr. v. Halmstads h. a. 1. sed. 37.
translated: Johnsson, Frida, high school teacher, Halmstad, b. 31/12/91 in Hästveda, Kristianstad County, daughter of Sven J. and his wife. She took her studentexamen (secondary school leaving exam) in Lund in 1914, and earned a bachelor's degree there in 1918. She worked there as a temporary lecturer, and also taught at private schools in Kopparberg (nowadays called Örebro) from 1918-1919, Åstorp from 1919-1922, and Sandviken from 1922-1923. She returned to Åstorp in 1923-1925, and then taught in Säter in 1925. In 1926-1927, she was a teacher in Klippan, and in Södertälje in 1927. She became an adjunct in history, social studies, and geography at Halmstad higher secondary school in 1937.
